extension.description: Automatically run Picture-in-Picture service code when Kodi starts. Use ramdisk for temporary folder!
Picture-in-Picture Dienst starte automatisch wenn Kodi startet. Verwende Ramdisk für den temporären Ordner!
extension.news:
V1.0.1 (2021-08-22) - Added important hint on ramdisk usage for temp folder - Fixed usage of height settings and added settings updates using monitor class - Fixed several spelling errors in en and de language - Added test if ffmpeg executable is available - Added try/catch to avoid exception if thumb.png does not exist, belongs to #2
V1.0.0 (2021-08-21) - first release of PIP addon - fixed installation of keymap file - fixes to prepare installation using a repository - renumbered already used version numbers to numbers lower than V1.0.0 in order to have V1.0.0 free for the 1st release
v0.5.1 (2021-08-16) - fixed ffmpeg capture settings for raspberry pi 4 and libreelec in order to avoid capturing broken images
v0.5.0 (2021-08-09) - improved image handling by using unique filename in order to force a reload by setImage() function - framerate up to 25 fps possible (but with high CPU load!)
v0.4.0 (2021-08-03) - replace "curl" by a native python implementation using urllib - added error handling for tvheadend connection - added error handling for m3u file format
v0.3.0 (2021-07-25) - put picture-in-picture handling in separate class - added setting "frames per seconds"
v0.2.0 (2021-07-23) - complete refactor "autostart.h", "pipffmepg.py" and "script.picture.pip" not longer required - only one service addons necessary - keymap uses now notifiyAll instead of a runScript call - prepared to run not only on librelec ... test on ubuntu installation passed
v0.1.0 (2021-07-17) - inital version
